xfli3.question: The flap slat electronic unit (FSEU) provides flap load relief for all aircraft from Flap 10 through to Flap 40.

dggv4.question: The yaw damper provides inputs to the rudder to provide which of the following, and what effect does it have on the rudder pedals?

options.text: Provides Gust Dampening, Dutch roll prevention and Turn coordination. The rudder pedals are not displaced by yaw damper operation.
Provides Gust Dampening and Turn coordination. The rudder pedals are not displaced by yaw damper operation.
Provides Gust Dampening, Dutch roll prevention and Turn coordination. The rudder pedals are displaced by yaw damper operation to provide feedback to the pilot.
Provides Gust Dampening and Turn coordination. The rudder pedals move to match rudder movement for feedback to the pilot.

fmbkd.question: How does the Stall Identification system help the pilot identify and prevent further movement into a stalled condition?

options.text: The elevator feel shift module prevents the yaw damper from making any rudder movement, and the stick shaker activates.
Elevator Feel Shift Module increase, hydraulic system A pressure to the Elevator Feel and Centering Unit, moving the elevator to provide at least 15 degrees of nose down pitch.
The yaw damper provides 2 degrees of rudder movement, and the speed trim system automatically pushes the control column forward to warn the pilot that a stall condition was being approached.

Elevator Feel Shift Module increase, hydraulic system A pressure to the Elevator Feel and Centering Unit, significantly increasing the force required to move the control column rearwards to continue into a stalled condition.

bl2s8f.question: Selecting the Flap lever to the FLAP 1 Gate causes the LE Flaps to move to what position?

options.text: Flap 1 position
Flap 15 position.
Takeoff setting
Fully Extended

irjng.question: What should the maximum flap extension altitude be?

options.text: 41,000 feet
2500 feet RA
Field elevation plus 1000 feet.
20,000 feet

tx8pr.question: What does a FLT CONTROL "LOW PRESSURE" light illuminated amber indicate?

options.text: The STBY RUD system pressure is low.
Both hydraulic systems pressure to ailerons, elevator and rudder are low.
Related hydraulic system pressure to ailerons, elevator and rudder is low.
This light is illuminated whenever the associated FLT CONTROL switch is in the OFF position.

o9eeu.question: On short field performance aircraft the leading edge slats do not move from the extended to the fully extended position until the Flap lever is moved beyond the Flap 25 position.

8m044.question: The flap slat electronic unit (FSEU) will close the trailing edge bypass valve if it detects trailing edge flap asymmetry, skew or uncommanded motion; thus stopping the movement of the flaps via the normal system.  However, the flaps can still be moved by means of electric motors.

9cautg.question: What happens to the speed brakes if the SPEED BRAKE lever is left in the DOWN position during landing.

options.text: The ground spoilers will deploy on landing if all other conditions are met, but flight spoilers will not deploy.
The speed brake lever will automatically move to the up position and the spoilers will deploy as normal if all other required conditions are met.
The spoilers will not deploy regardless of all other required conditions being met.
The flight spoilers will deploy on landing if all other conditions are met, but ground spoilers will not deploy.

ljjin.question: What does the SPEED BRAKE DO NOT ARM light (located on the left forward panel) indicate when illuminated amber?

options.text: The speed brakes must not be extended as airspeed currently too high for safe operation.
Indicates an abnormal condition or test input in the speed brake system.

Indicates an abnormal condition or test input in the speed brake system and indicates that the wheel speed has dropped below 60 kts on landing and the speedbrake lever has not been moved to the down position.
Illuminated whenever forward thrust levers are advanced beyond takeoff thrust whilst aircraft on the ground

ca3wl.question: What is the purpose of the ALTERNATE FLAPS master switch, and why is the cover red?

options.text: Closes the trailing edge flap bypass valve, activates standby pump, and arms ALTERNATE FLAPS position switch.  Red because the action of extending the trailing edge devices cannot be reversed in flight.

Closes the trailing edge flap bypass valve, activates standby pump, and arms ALTERNATE FLAPS position switch.  Red because the action of extending the leading edge devices cannot be reversed in flight.
Fully extends the leading and trailing edge flaps. Red because the action cannot be reversed, leading and trailing edge devices cannot be retracted once extended.

Fully extends the leading edge devices, and can extend and retract the trailing edge flaps. Red because the action cannot be reversed, leading and trailing edge devices cannot be retracted once extended.

vb8ls.question: What will cause the STBY RUDDER ON light to illuminate?

options.text: Standby rudder system is commanded on, either manually or automatically, to pressurise the standby rudder PCU.
Standby rudder system is commanded on, to pressurise the standby rudder PCU, by selecting YAW DAMPER switch to OFF.

Only illuminated when the standby rudder system has been automatically commanded on - not illuminated when standby rudder system has been manually commanded on by selecting the FLT CONTROL switch to STBY RUD.
Only illuminated when the standby rudder system has been manually commanded on by selecting a FLT CONTROL switch to STBY RUD - not illuminated when standby rudder system automatically commanded on.

yrc3x.question: On landing, when do the ground spoilers extend?

options.text: Compression of the right main landing gear strut.
Compression of the nose landing gear.
Compression of the left main landing gear strut.
Compression of any landing gear strut.
